contextId.occurrenceNote: The implicit information can be supplied from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "I said to you as you were lying in your blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: I said to you in your blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood words may be supplied. Alternate translation: "have oppressed people ... and plundered others" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

This sentence does not say what is in the cup because it is understood by reading [Ezekiel 23:31](../23/31.md). Alternate translation: "this cup contains a great amount of punishment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: this cup contains a great amount

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "same day" refers to the previous phrase "make my sanctuary unclean." Alternate translation: "on the same day on which they make my sanctuary unclean, they defile my Sabbaths" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: on the same day they defile my Sabbaths

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "the sheep or goats" are left out of this phrase, but they are intended to be understood. Alternate translation: "the sheep or goats that are lost" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

The words "the sheep or goats" are left out of this phrase, but they are intended to be understood. Alternate translation: "the sheep or goats that are lost" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
The word "sheep" is understood. Alternate translation: "the fat sheep and the strong sheep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

The word "chamber" or "room" is understood from the previous phrase. The phrase "facing south" means that its door is on its south side, and "facing north" means that its door is on its north side. Alternate translation: "one room on the north side facing south, and the other room on the south side facing north" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: one on the north side facing south, and the other on the south side facing north
